unittitle.value: Friends of City Hall Park Papers

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The Friends of City Hall Park Papers contain materials from the Friends of City Hall Park, an advocacy group, and its campaigns to better City Hall Park in lower Manhattan. Within this collection are materials pertaining to the park itself as well as other organizations that assisted Friends of City Hall Park. The materials include correspondence, ephemera, newspaper clippings, and maps.

p.value: This collection should be cited as the Friends of City Hall Park Papers, MS 1335, The New-York Historical Society.
<emph render="italic">City Hall Park: New York’s Historic Commons</emph> (New York: City of New York, 1999).

The collection contains materials from the start of the Friends of City Hall Park through its successful campaign to reopen the Northern section of the Park after it was closed following the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks.

dsc.value:
Series I: Friends of City Hall Park 1996-2009 Scope and Content

Within this series there is a wide variety of material from the Friends of City Hall Park, dating back to its formation. These materials consist of correspondence, newspaper articles, information handouts, notes, and ephemera.

 Subseries A: Correspondence 1 1996-2008, undated Scope and Content

This subseries contains correspondence both to and from the Friends of City Hall Park. Within the correspondence from the Friends of City Hall Park, the correspondence is both to New York City officials and to other organizations. Many of the letters to the Friends of City Hall Park are from civic officials, responding to letters that had been sent to them. Many of the aforementioned correspondence was either signed by or written to Skip Blumberg, president of Friends of City Hall Park. Of particular interest is the correspondence from letter writing campaigns. New Yorkers wrote to officials, letting them know what City Hall Park means to them. In one instance, a woman wrote to George Steinbrenner, former owner of the New York Yankees, urging him to support City Hall Park.

 Correspondence to Friends of City Hall Park 1 1 1996-2000 Correspondence to Friends of City Hall Park 1 2 2001-2008, undated Correspondence from Friends of City Hall Park 1 3 1997-2001 Correspondence from Friends of City Hall Park 1 4 2002-2007, undated Legal Correspondence and Memos 1 5 1998-2008, undated Letter Campaigns 1 6 1997-2000, undated Subseries B: Administrative and Promotional Materials 1 1996-2009, undated Scope and Content

Within this subseries are materials that the Friends of City Hall Park utilized in its everyday operations. The bulk of this subseries is made up of information materials that outline the Friends’ campaign to better City Hall Park and the various issues that the park faced.

 Corporate Organization Papers 1 7 1999, undated Friends of City Hall Park Information Materials 1 8 1996-1998 Friends of City Hall Park Information Materials 1 9 1999-2000 Friends of City Hall Park Information Materials 1 10 2001-2008 Friends of City Hall Park Information Materials 1 11 undated Portions of Speeches, Articles, and other Promotional Material 1 12 1997-1999, undated Administrative and Event Notes 1 13 1997-2009, undated Fundraising Information and Notes 1 14 1998-1999, undated Letterhead 1 15 undated Subseries C: Multimedia Materials 2 3 1 1996-2004, undated Scope and Content

There are a wide variety of materials within this subseries, all of which document the Friends of City Hall Park. There are DVDs of appearances made by Skip Blumberg, president of the Friends of City Hall Park. There are also many photographs of the members of the organization as well as others who partook in various events at City Hall Park. The bulk of the photographs were taken in 1997. There are also two VHS tapes, one of which is the 1996 major motion picture City Hall, starring Al Pacino, John Cusack, and Bridget Fonda. The other VHS is of a more personal nature, entitled Skip…The Best Friend of City Hall Park. There is also an autographed copy of the 1997 book, Sleeping with the Mayor, which tells the story of protesters in City Hall Park.

 CDs, DVDs, and Zip Disks 1 16 2007, undated Photographs 2 1 1997 Photographs 2 2 1997 Photographs 2 3 1997 Photographs 2 4 1998-1999 Photographs 2 5 2003-2004 Photographs 2 6 undated City Hall [VHS] 3 1996 Skip…The Best Friend of City Hall Park [VHS] 3 1997 Sleeping with the Mayor [book] 3 1997 Subseries D: Newspaper Coverage 4 1996-2008, undated Scope and Content

These articles, taken from a variety of New York City newspapers, follow any and all coverage of City Hall Park from 1996 through 2008.

 Newspaper Articles 4 1 1996-1997 Newspaper Articles 4 2 1998 Newspaper Articles 4 3 January-May 1999 Newspaper Articles 4 4 June-December, 1999 Newspaper Articles 4 5 2000 Newspaper Articles 4 6 2001 Newspaper Articles 4 7 2002-2003 Newspaper Articles 4 8 2005-2006 Newspaper Articles 4 9 February-March 2007 Newspaper Articles 4 10 July-November 2007 Newspaper Articles 4 11 2008-2009 Newspaper Articles 4 12 undated Newspaper Articles 4 13 undated Subseries E: Notes and Ephemera 5 4 1997-1999, undated Scope and Content

Within this subseries are a variety of ephemera. There are membership forms and fliers for events from the Friends of City Hall Park. Of note is a Friends of City Hall Park t-shirt.

 Friends of City Hall Park Membership Forms 4 13 undated Fliers 4 14 undated Handwritten Notes 4 15 undated Ephemera 4 16 undated Folders and Envelopes 4 17 1997-1999, undated Folders and Envelopes 4 18 undated Friends of City Hall Park T-Shirt 5 undated Series II: Government, Park, Activist, and Other Organizations 6 1992-2008 Scope and Content

This series consists of materials from government and community organizations that the Friends of City Hall Park interacted with during their campaigns to better City Hall Park. Similar to Series I, this series contains correspondence, information materials, notes, and ephemera dating back to the late 1990s through to 2008.

 Subseries A: Government Organizations 6 1992-2008 Scope and Content

The bulk of the material in this subseries comes from the City of New York’s Department of Parks & Recreation. Much like the Friends of City Hall Park series, there is correspondence, general information, notes, and ephemera. There are also materials from other government officials.

 City of New York Parks & Recreation Correspondence 6 1 1997- 2003 City of New York Parks & Recreation Memos 6 2 1997-1998, undated City of New York Parks & Recreation Notes and Ephemera 6 3 1997-2003, undated Partnership for Parks 6 4 1997-1998, undated Municipal and State Materials 6 5 1997-2008, undated City of New York Parks & Recreation Oversized Posters OS 1 undated Subseries B: Park, Activist, and Other Organizations 6 1992-2008, undated Scope and Content

This subseries contains materials from organizations involved with the Friends of City Hall Park. There is correspondence, informational material, and notes from these organizations. There is also a fair amount of ephemera including fliers, pins, and buttons. Of interest are fliers from activist organizations against the (then) mayor of New York City, Rudolph W. Giuliani.

 Citizens Committee for New York City 6 6 1999, undated Community Board No. 1 6 7 1996-2008 New Yorkers for Parks Information Materials 6 8 2004-2008, undated New Yorkers for Parks Maps, Reports, and Ephemera 6 9 2003-2006, undated Materials from Other Community and Activist Organizations 6 10 1992-2007, undated Ephemera from Other Community Organizations 6 11 1999, undated Activist Ephemera 6 12 undated Ephemera 6 13 1996-2002, undated Series III: New York City Parks 6 1996-2005, undated Scope and Content

Within this series is information about parks in New York City. The series covers City Hall Park as well as other urban parks and contains maps and other assorted relevant information.

 Subseries A: City Hall Park 6 1996-2005, undated Scope and Content

This subseries concerns City Hall Park itself. Materials within the subseries include official documents, pamphlets on history, maps of the park, and ephemera from events hosted by New York City within the Park.

 Official Documents Concerning City Hall Park 6 14 undated City Hall Park History 6 15 1996-1999 Maps of City Hall Park 6 16 1998-2003 Maps of City Hall Park 6 17 undated Events Hosted by New York City 6 18 1996-2005 Oversized Official Documents Concerning City Hall Park OS 1 undated Oversized Maps of City Hall Park OS 1 1998, undated Subseries B: Other Parks and Relevant Material 6 1996-1999, undated Scope and Content

Within this subseries is a variety of information concerning parks in New York City. There is information concerning plants and animals, gardening, tour companies, and maps.

 Plants, Animals, and Gardening Information 6 19 1996-1999, undated Information on Other Parks 6 20 undated Tour Companies 6 21 1999, undated Maps 6 22 undated
